SEARCH
Package algorithms.graphs

Class GraphUtil

java.lang.Object
algorithms.graphs.GraphUtil
public class GraphUtil extends Object
miscellaneous graph methods. TODO: consider a method to remap vertex keys for input graphs that start counting at 1 instead of 0 (they need vertex 0 removed and all vertex numbers and vertex numbers in edges decreased by 1.
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • createAdjacencyList

      public static SimpleLinkedListNode[] createAdjacencyList(NewmanGMLParser.GMLGraph g)
      create an adjacency list from the given graph knowing that the vertexes present are numbered 0 through number of vertexes-1. Note that even if more than one edge is present in the directionCCW from vertex u to vertex v, only one is present in the adjacency list for that directional edge in the returned adjacency list. runtime complexity is O(|V| + |E|).
      Parameters:
      g -
      Returns:

    • createAdjacencyList2

      public static SimpleLinkedListNode[] createAdjacencyList2(NewmanGMLParser.GMLGraph g)
      create an adjacency list from a graph which may be missing vertex information and might not be numbered from 0 to |V|-1. runtime complexity is O((|V|*log_2(|V|( * |E|) which is longer due to a needed sort. Note that even if more than one edge is present in the directionCCW from vertex u to vertex v, only one is present in the adjacency list for that directional edge in the returned adjacency list.
      Parameters:
      g -
      Returns:

    • convertGraph

      public static SimpleLinkedListNode[] convertGraph(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> g)
      convert the adjacency graph g in TIntObjectMap TIntSet into a graph built with SimpleLinkedListNode[]. note that this method assumes that the vertexes are ordered such that the final range of indexes returned is [0, max Vertex number].
      Parameters:
      g -
      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • measureBandwidth

      public static int measureBandwidth(Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> adjMap)
      Find the bandwidth of the given graph as the maximum distance between 2 adjacent vertices where the distance is the absolute difference between the index numbers.
      Parameters:
      adjMap -
      Returns:
      the maximum difference between vertex numbers of adjacent vertexes. returns -1 for a map without edges.

      public static int[] findMaxDegreeVertex(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> adjMap)
      find the vertex with the largest number of neighbors.
      Parameters:
      adjMap - an adjacency map with key = vertex index and values = adjacent vertexes
      Returns:
      the vertex index with the largest number of neighbors and the degree

    • createDegreeMapForVertices

    • subtractVertex

      public static void subtractVertex(int v, Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> adjMap, Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> revAdjMap)
      given graph G=(v,E) as the adjacency map adjMap, subtract vertex v from the graph. Note that the vertexes adjacent to v are expected to still be present in the map as keys themselves. More specifically, this method removes v as key in adjMap and v in any values of adjMap. revAdjMap is also updated.
      Parameters:
      adjMap -

    • createReverseMapping

      public static Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> createReverseMapping(Map<Integer,Set<Integer>> adjMap)

    • findMaxDegreeVertex

      public static int findMaxDegreeVertex(Set<Integer> p, Map<Integer,Integer> degreeMap)
      given a degree map holding key=vertex, value=degree and a set of vertexes p, find the vertex in p that has the largest value in degreeMap
      Parameters:
      p -
      degreeMap -
      Returns:
      the vertex in p that has the largest value in degreeMap. if no members of p are in degreeMap, a -1 is returned.

    • findMaxDegreeVertex

      public static int findMaxDegreeVertex(Map<Integer,Integer> degreeMap)
      given degreeMap holding key=vertex, value=degree, return the vertex with largest value
      Parameters:
      degreeMap -
      Returns:
      the vertex with largest value
